newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila's Bonifacio reports land sales.
newsitem.headline: Manila's Bonifacio reports land sales.

text.p: The Fort Bonifacio Development Corp, a joint venture company between a private sector consortium and the Philippine government, said on Monday it had sold 16 hectares of developed land at an aggreagate 28.946 billion pesos as of October this year.
The company said 20 buyers would develop the lots into about 1,603,092 square metres of floor space.
Most of the buyers are members of the private sector consortium led by Metro Pacific Corp, the flagship company of First Pacific Co Ltd in the Philippines.
Fort Bonifacio is developing 214 hectares of land in a former military camp, just outside Manila's Makati business district, into the country's next commercial and financial district.
The consortium, which is the developer of the land, bought the right to develop the 214 hectares of land at 39.2 billion pesos. - Manila newsroom 63 2 8418938 Fax 8176267
